meanings.sent1: The teacher foreordains the schedule for the week on Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast foreordains rain for tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The magic show foreordains the trick before the audience even arrives.
meanings.sent4: Fate foreordains our paths, guiding us towards our destinies.
meanings.sent5: The ancient prophecy foreordains the rise of a new hero to save the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: Some believe that our actions are foreordained by a higher power.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller claimed to foreordain the future of her clients.
meanings.sent3: The psychic joked that she could foreordain the winning lottery numbers.
meanings.sent4: Legends say the ancient artifact can foreordain the fate of nations.
meanings.sent5: The old book seemed to foreordain the events that unfolded in the town.

meanings.sent1: The king would foreordain the laws of the land before each new year.
meanings.sent2: The prophecy seemed to foreordain the rise of a new ruler.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly foreordains that everyone must eat dessert first.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tablet foreordains the coming of a great flood.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder seemed to foreordain the success of the young warrior.
